comment._content:
Currently on display at Canada Aviation and Space Museum in Ottawa following major restoration.
This was a French Le Rhone powered example donated by the French government to the Canadian Dominion archivist and was used (along with a French 75 cannon and an extensive collection of war posters) for war bond fundraising across Canada and the US until the Influenza epidemic hit, when it was put in storage where it remained until the 1960s, when the Air Force "restored" it. Since they knew nothing of its history they assumed it must have been a British Beardmore built example and proceeded to butcher the airframe, modifying the ailerons to remove washout, creating a new fin and rudder and changing the engine to a Clerget (which their references said was the only engine that was supposed to have been used), and adding a Scarf gun ring. The restoration returned it to its original appearance (aluminium doped overall and in French markings), and even re-united it with the original engine it had when it arrived in Canada.
